PublishersÂ¶

Creating a Publisher NodeÂ¶

1. Create Node

Inherit from rclcpp::Node.

2. Create Publisher

Define the topic and queue size.

3. Publish

Send messages periodically (e.g., using a timer).

ImplementationÂ¶

ðŸ“„ Complete C++ Example
 1#include "rclcpp/rclcpp.hpp"
 2#include "std_msgs/msg/string.hpp"
 3
 4class MinimalPublisher : public rclcpp::Node
 5{
 6public:
 7  MinimalPublisher() : Node("minimal_publisher")
 8  {
 9    // Create publisher on topic "chatter" with queue size 10
10    publisher_ = this->create_publisher<std_msgs::msg::String>("chatter", 10);
11
12    // Create timer (500ms)
13    timer_ = this->create_wall_timer(
14      std::chrono::milliseconds(500),
15      std::bind(&MinimalPublisher::timer_callback, this));
16  }
17
18private:
19  void timer_callback()
20  {
21    auto msg = std::make_unique<std_msgs::msg::String>();
22    msg->data = "Hello ROS 2";
23    RCLCPP_INFO(this->get_logger(), "Publishing: '%s'", msg->data.c_str());
24    publisher_->publish(std::move(msg));
25  }
26
27  rclcpp::Publisher<std_msgs::msg::String>::SharedPtr publisher_;
28  rclcpp::TimerBase::SharedPtr timer_;
29};

Key ParametersÂ¶

Topic Name

"chatter" (The channel nodes talk over)

Queue Size

10 (Affects buffering and QoS behavior)

TestingÂ¶

ros2 run my_package minimal_publisher
ros2 topic echo /chatter
